revised_title: Dynamics of the CA3 Pyramidal Neuron Autoassociative Memory Network in the Hippocampus
tldr: This article presents a theory for the dynamics of sparse associative memory applied to the pyramidal recurrent network in the hippocampus. The CA3 region is modeled as a network of pyramidal neurons connected through their recurrent collaterals, with inhibitory interneurons regulating the membrane potentials. The theory considers the storage of memories, recall process, and the role of inhibitory interneurons in the hippocampal network.
